clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the prevention of disseminated i Mycobacterium avium i complex MAC disease in patients with advanced HIV infection

contraindications.disease: LD sub 50 sub 4 8 g kg mouse male
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Rifabutin is an antibiotic that inhibits DNA dependent RNA polymerase activity in susceptible cells Specifically it interacts with bacterial RNA polymerase but does not inhibit the mammalian enzyme It is bactericidal and has a very broad spectrum of activity against most gram positive and gram negative organisms including i Pseudomonas aeruginosa i and specifically i Mycobacterium tuberculosis i Because of rapid emergence of resistant bacteria use is restricted to treatment of mycobacterial infections and a few other indications Rifabutin is well absorbed when taken orally and is distributed widely in body tissues and fluids including the CSF It is metabolized in the liver and eliminated in bile and to a much lesser extent in urine but dose adjustments are unnecessary with renal insufficiency

incompatibilities.description: The metabolism of Aripiprazole can be increased when combined with Rifabutin
The metabolism of Aripiprazole lauroxil can be increased when combined with Rifabutin
The serum concentration of the active metabolites of Rifabutin can be increased when Rifabutin is used in combination with Nelfinavir
The serum concentration of the active metabolites of Rifabutin can be increased when Rifabutin is used in combination with Indinavir
The serum concentration of Rifabutin can be decreased when it is combined with Nevirapine
The serum concentration of the active metabolites of Rifabutin can be increased when Rifabutin is used in combination with Ritonavir
The serum concentration of 25 O Desacetylrifabutin an active metabolite of Rifabutin can be increased when used in combination with Atazanavir
The therapeutic efficacy of Clopidogrel can be increased when used in combination with Rifabutin
The metabolism of Rifabutin can be increased when combined with Efavirenz
The serum concentration of Rifabutin can be increased when it is combined with Elvitegravir
The serum concentration of Etravirine can be decreased when it is combined with Rifabutin

The metabolism of Ifosfamide can be increased when combined with Rifabutin
